wiki.article.standard.town.title: Town
wiki.article.standard.town.text: Town is the main good faction. Usually, the majority of the players in each game are townies. They don't start knowing who each other are, unlike the mafia or the cult. Town wins by eliminating all opposing teams (mafia, cult, arsonist, werewolf, etc). Town needs to work together to find out who the evils are. Their main power is in communication and voting, so if you are a townie who does not communicate, you are not helping your team win.
wiki.article.standard.mafia.title: Mafia
wiki.article.standard.mafia.text: The Mafia is the main evil faction. There are fewer mafia members than townies, but they know who each other are. The mafia wins by eliminating all opposing teams. The mafia kills and lies to get people to execute innocent townies in order to get rid of the town. The mafia can communicate at night to create strategies and help each other lie. Most mafia roles can't select each other to use their ability. The mafia always has a godfather who attacks someone each night. If the godfather dies, a new mafia member becomes the godfather.
wiki.article.standard.neutral.title: Neutral
wiki.article.standard.neutral.text: Neutrals are not all on the same team. Each neutral role has special win conditions. Most of them are against both the town and the mafia. Some neutral roles can win before the game ends like the jester, executioner, and doomsayer. Other roles need to be the last one alive like werewolf and arsonist. All of the werewolves are on the same team but don't start knowing who each other are, the same goes for arsonists.
wiki.article.standard.cult.title: Cult
wiki.article.standard.cult.text: The Cult is an alternative evil faction that can convert other players to join their cult. They win by eliminating all opposing teams. Cultists can communicate at night and they can not select each other, much like the mafia.
wiki.article.standard.roleLabel.title: Role Label
wiki.article.standard.roleLabel.text: A role label might appear next to a players name on the player list. It shows what their role is. For example, mafia members can see the roles of their teammates through role labels. If a mayor reveals, the mayor will gain a role label. It is possible for a role label to be inaccurate, for instance, if a mayor is converted to a cultist, their label might not change.
wiki.article.standard.interview.title: Interview
wiki.article.standard.interview.text: A journalist can interview a player during the night, allowing the journalist to speak with them. The player being interviewed may not know who the journalist is, but everyone knows the journalist is on the town team.
wiki.article.standard.journal.title: Journal
wiki.article.standard.journal.text: The journalist has a journal which is posted publicly every morning the journalist chooses to. Everyone knows the journal was written by the journalist so they know the information is trustworthy. The journalist may interview a player each night to gain information to include in the journal.
wiki.article.standard.forged.title: Forged
wiki.article.standard.forged.text: A player who is forged had their alibi and role changed by the forger on their grave.
wiki.article.standard.fullMoon.title: Full Moon
wiki.article.standard.fullMoon.text: Every night is a full moon night except night one and night three. The Werewolf has a different ability depending on whether or not it is a full moon night.
wiki.article.standard.vision.title: Vision
wiki.article.standard.vision.text: Visions are the investigative result that a Psychic receives. Good visions show a list of two players that contains at least one townie. Evil visions show a list of three players that contains at least one non-townie. An Aura can effect a psychic vision. A player with a suspicious aura will not show up in a good vision, and a player with an innocent aura will not show up in an evil vision.
wiki.article.standard.select.title: Select
wiki.article.standard.select.text: Selecting is when you click the button under a player at night in order to attempt to use your ability on them. Selecting determines who you will visit before it becomes affected by other effects. By default, you can select a number of players up to as many targets as your role can have. Most roles can not select themselves or dead players, and some roles have further restrictions on selections. Most mafia members and cultists can not select other players on their team.
wiki.article.standard.visit.title: Visit
wiki.article.standard.visit.text:
Usually, visits are decided by selecting players. Visits are what actually causes active abilities to work. For example: A Detective could select a player, but a Witch could possess them to make them visit someone else, and then the Detective will unknowingly get their results from the player that they visited instead of the player they selected.

Visits can have properties such as astral or attacking.
   - An astral visit is undetected by most roles.
    - An attacking visit will attempt to kill the player being visited. Bodyguards' and trappers' abilities will work differently if the visit is an attack.
wiki.article.standard.target.title: Target
wiki.article.standard.target.text: Your target is the player who you visit.
wiki.article.standard.indirect.title: Indirect
wiki.article.standard.indirect.text: An indirect ability is one that does not visit. Therefore, it is unable to be seen by a lookout or tracker or affected by many other abilities.
wiki.article.standard.convert.title: Convert
wiki.article.standard.convert.text:
A player's role is changed. All of their ability uses are refilled to maximum. _For Example:_
- If someone is converted to a Veteran, they get all three alerts.
- An Apostle can convert players into cultists.
wiki.article.standard.roleblock.title: Roleblock
wiki.article.standard.roleblock.text: A player who is roleblocked has their visits erased. A player's visits being erased often means they can't use their ability. Some roles are immune or not affected by being roleblocked. Escort and Hypnotist are roles that can roleblock other players and are both immune to being roleblocked.
wiki.article.standard.jail.title: Jail
wiki.article.standard.jail.text: A Jailor can put a player in jail. When a player is in jail, they can talk with the Jailor at night, the Jailor can choose to execute them, they can't select anyone, and most abilities visiting the jailed player will fail.
wiki.article.standard.rampage.title: Rampage
wiki.article.standard.rampage.text: All the visitors to a rampaged player are indirectly attacked.
wiki.article.standard.possess.title: Possess
wiki.article.standard.possess.text: A player who is possessed had their visits changed by the Witch, Necromancer, or Retributionist. Some roles have immunity to possession: Witch, Necromancer, Retributionist, Veteran
wiki.article.standard.defense.title: Defense
wiki.article.standard.defense.text:
Attacks and defense have 3 tiers each. An attack can either be basic, armor-piercing, or protection-piercing.

A defense can either be armored, protected, or invincible.

A basic attack can not kill a player who is armored, and an armor-piercing attack can not kill a player who is protected. A protection-piercing attack can overpower armor as well as protection.

 Some roles have armor by default, usually evil ones. Protection can be granted to players through abilities like the Guardian's ability to protect their target. A player with invincible defense can only die by getting lynched or leaving the game.

Unless otherwise indicated, attacks are basic by default and will not be able to kill players who are armored or protected. Indirect is not a tier of attack.
wiki.article.standard.protect.title: Protect
wiki.article.standard.protect.text: Protect means to increase someone's defense to protected for a night.
wiki.article.standard.dead.title: Dead
wiki.article.standard.dead.text: If a player is dead, they can't vote, their grave will likely be in the graveyard, and they usually can't use their ability anymore. Dead players can only speak with other dead players with the exception of the Medium and its target. A player needs to die to become dead. All players start the game alive! (What did you expectâ€¦)
wiki.article.standard.silenced.title: Silenced
wiki.article.standard.silenced.text:
A player who is silenced can not talk or otherwise communicate during that day, and they can not vote for players during the voting phase. They can still vote during the judgement phase. If the silenced player is put on trial, they still can't talk. If the players are talking out loud, silenced players should not speak or use any type of communication, including signals or facial expressions. If a player can't use chat, they are not allowed to communicate.

 A Blackmailer can silence a player each night.
wiki.article.standard.friends.title: Friends
wiki.article.standard.friends.text: A Seer's result which indicates that the two players they visited can win together.
wiki.article.standard.enemies.title: Enemies
wiki.article.standard.enemies.text: A Seer's result which indicates that the two players they visited can not win together.
wiki.article.standard.alert.title: Alert
wiki.article.standard.alert.text: A Veterans ability. If you visit a veteran on the night they are on alert, they will indirectly attack you with an armor-piercing attack. A Veteran can go on Alert up to three times.
wiki.article.standard.haunt.title: Haunt
wiki.article.standard.haunt.text: After they die, a Medium can haunt a living player to allow them to communicate with the dead during the night. The haunted player is added to the dead chat group at night. If multiple mediums haunt multiple players, they can all speak with each other and all dead players.
wiki.article.standard.transport.title: Transport
wiki.article.standard.transport.text:
A transporter can transport players.
Two players who are transported with each other will have all of their visitors swapped. So if a Detective goes to visit a player who's transported with another player, then the Detective will actually visit the other player.
wiki.article.standard.innocent.title: Innocent
wiki.article.standard.innocent.text:
Innocent has multiple meanings.
- A result the Detective can get usually indicating the player they visited is a townie.
- Voting for someone to not be lynched during judgement phase. If there are more guilty votes than innocent ones, the player on trial is lynched.
wiki.article.standard.suspicious.title: Suspicious
wiki.article.standard.suspicious.text: A result the Detective can get usually indicating the player they visited is evil.
wiki.article.standard.guilty.title: Guilty
wiki.article.standard.guilty.text: A guilty vote during the judgement phase is a vote for the player on trial to be executed. If there are more Guilty votes than Innocent votes, the player on trial is lynched.
wiki.article.standard.abstain.title: Abstain
wiki.article.standard.abstain.text: Abstaining is when a player does not vote during a Judgment phase. If all players Abstain, then the player on trial is not lynched.
wiki.article.standard.cleaned.title: Cleaned
wiki.article.standard.cleaned.text: A player who is cleaned had their role and alibi erased from the graveyard. A Janitor can visit people on the night that they die to clean their grave.
wiki.article.standard.evil.title: Evil
wiki.article.standard.evil.text: If a role is evil, it means a role is non-town. A psychic can receive evil visions to learn who is not on town.
wiki.article.standard.roleLimit.title: Role Limit
wiki.article.standard.roleLimit.text: A roles limit is the maximum number of that role that can be generated at the start of a regular game. If there is no limit, there can be any number of that role. Because the veteran has a role limit of one, there can not be more than one veteran unless manually forced into the role list or an amnesiac becomes one
wiki.article.standard.doused.title: Doused
wiki.article.standard.doused.text: Arsonists can douse players, then later ignite, to deal an indirect, protection-piercing attack to all doused players. If there is an arsonist alive then doused players have a suspicious aura.
wiki.article.standard.backup.title: Backup
wiki.article.standard.backup.text: The Godfather can choose another mafia member to be their backup at any time. If the Godfather is roleblocked or in jail, the backup will attack their selection instead.
wiki.article.standard.aura.title: Aura
wiki.article.standard.aura.text:
Players can have an aura that change how they appear to investigative roles.
- A player with a suspicious aura is:
    - Suspicious to a Detective
    - Enemies with everyone to the seer
    - Never in the psychics good vision
- A player with an innocent aura is:
    - Innocent to the detective
    - Friends with everyone to the seer
    - Never in the psychics evil vision
wiki.article.standard.appearedVisit.text:
A player could _appear_ to have visited someone, even though they didn't. This is usually caused by evil roles such as Framer.

This only affects investigative roles.

_Examples_

The Tracker can see the appeared visit, but not the real visit.

A Veteran doesn't attack a player who appeared to visit them and didn't actually visit them.
wiki.article.standard.astral.title: Astral
wiki.article.standard.astral.text: If a Visit is astral that means it is undetected by most roles. Lookouts and Trackers won't see an astral visit. The Veteran won't attack someone who visited with an astral visit, However the Transporter will still transport astral visits.
wiki.article.standard.roleOutline.title: Role Outline
wiki.article.standard.roleOutline.text:
A role outline defines a group of roles.

Outlines can either be a predefined role set, an exact role, or a union of multiple.

_Examples_

"Any" It could be any role

"Neutral" Could be any possible neutral role.

"Town Support" Could be an Escort, Retributionist, Transporter, or Medium

"Godfather" Could only be a Godfather.

"Amnesiac + Psychic" Could either be an Amnesiac or Psychic.

- When roles are generated randomly from a role outline, each possible role is equally likely to generate.
- Role outlines are used in the outline list to show what roles could be in the game.
wiki.article.standard.outlineList.title: Outline List
wiki.article.standard.outlineList.text: The outline list defines what roles are in the game. At the start of a game, each player gets assigned to a role outline. Then, their role is generated randomly from that role outline.
wiki.article.standard.chatGroup.title: Chat Group
wiki.article.standard.chatGroup.text:
Messages are sent to chat groups. The chat groups are:
 - All (no icon)
 - Dead ðŸ’€
 - Mafia ðŸŒ¹
 - Cult ðŸ•¯ï¸
 - Jail ðŸ”’
 - Interview ðŸ“

 Players can be in multiple chat groups at once, or even read chat groups they are not in.
wiki.article.standard.fastForward.title: Fast Forward
wiki.article.standard.fastForward.text: If all players vote to fast forward, the current phase skips to having 10 seconds left. Voting to fast forward is completly anonymous. To vote to fast forward, press the fast forward button in the top left
wiki.article.standard.how_to_play.title: How to play
wiki.article.standard.how_to_play.text:
The game has two major teams, Town and Mafia (Or alternatively, the Cult). The goal for each team is to be the last team remaining. The town wins if they find out who the mafia are and vote to execute or kill them. The mafia wins by deceiving the town and staying hidden in order to not get executed or killed.

Every role has abilities that they can use to try to win. Abilities can do things such as attack players, prevent kills, or find out what role other players are.
The game is about communication, so townies need to share information to find the mafia as quick as possible, while mafia needs to spread misinformation to try to get townies to turn against each other to make winning easier.

**MULTIPLE PLAYERS CAN HAVE THE SAME ROLE**

There are also neutral roles that have their own win conditions as described in their role wiki page.
wiki.article.standard.phases_and_timelin:
The game is always in a phase. Phases run in this order:

### Night
This is when most roles use their abilities. Chat is closed at night so most players can not communicate with each other. Some roles have abilities that allow them to communicate with others at night such as the medium, who can talk to the dead, or the mafia, who can talk with each other.

### Morning
Players see who died last night, their alibi, and any death notes that were placed on the body. 

### Discussion
Players discuss information they have to try to find out who the evil players are, or if theyâ€™re evil themselves, pretend to be a townie. Evil players will often try to throw out red herrings or pin the blame on someone else.

### Voting
Players vote to put a player on trial, but this doesnâ€™t always mean that player is going to be killed. The players need a majority of the votes in order to put someone onto trial. If the voting phase ends before a majority is reached, it goes directly to night after. There can be a maximum of three trials during each day.

### Testimony
This phase comes after voting only if a player was voted onto trial. The player on trial gives their testimony while everyone else stays quiet. Usually the player on trial will claim a role and post their alibi here.

If you have been voted for a trial, donâ€™t give up. Even if youâ€™re evil, you can lie your way out of getting hanged.
### Judgment
This phase comes after testimony. Everyone votes either innocent, or guilty. If there are more guilty votes than innocent votes, the player on trial is killed. Players can also choose to abstain. The judgement period is usually how the town gets evil players killed.

### Evening
A brief period before night. If someone was voted guilty today, this is usually where they get to say their final words.

When there are three or less players alive, each phase is half as long as it usually is.
wiki.article.standard.priority.title: Priority
wiki.article.standard.priority.text:
Abilities are used in a specific order called priority order. If two players have abilities that go on the same priority, the player with the lower player number will go first. It is recommended that you read a roles encyclopedia page before this page. Some abilities go before night starts. Attacking someone doesn't kill them until the end of the night. Here are all the priorities and the abilities that happen in them.

**Before Night (Not a priority)**

- Jailor chooses who to jail
- Journalist chooses who to interview
- Spy finds if an apostle can convert
- Death kills everyone
- Create Visits
  - All visits are decided by who is selected by each players. During each priority, each associated ability is activated using who is being visited by who, which is not necessarily who the player selected (in the case of a transporter, witch, etc...).

**1: Top Priority**

- Amnesiac (Convert)
- Doomsayer (Kill)
- Executioner (Suicide)
- Jester (Haunt)
- Veteran (Decide to Alert)
- Vigilante (Suicide)

**2: Transporter**

- Transporter (Swap Visits)

**3: Control**

- Witch (Possess)

**4: Necromancy**

- Retributionist (Possess/Change Visits)
- Necromancer (Possess/Change Visits)

**5: roleblock**

- Reveler (roleblock)
- Hypnotist (roleblock)
- Escort (roleblock)
- Jailor (Invisible roleblock)

**6: Deception**

-Hypnotist (Hypnotize)
- Framer (Frame)
- Blackmailer (Silence)
- Janitor (Clean)
- Arsonist (Douse)

**7: Bodyguard**

- Bodyguard (Change visits)

**8: Heal**

- Trapper (Prepare to dismantle, set, or use trap)
- Bodyguard (Defend themselves)
- Crusader (Defend target)
- Guardian (Defend)
- Veteran (Defend themselves)

**9: Kill**

- Apostle (Kill)
- Zealot (Kill)
- Martyr (Kill)
- Trapper (Indirect Kill)
- Arsonist (Ignite)
- Bodyguard (Attack attacker)
- Crusader (Attack Visitor)
- Godfather (Attack or Make Backup Attack)
- Jailor (Attack)
- Mafioso (Attack)
- Veteran (Rampage)
- Vigilante (Attack)
- Werewolf (Rampage and attacks)

**10: Investigative**

-Journalist (Add Journal Message)
- Psychic (Vision)
- Trapper (Traps report info)
- Trapper (Dismantle if should) 
- Arsonist (Find who is doused)
- Bodyguard (Find if protected)
- Consigliere (Investigate)
- Crusader (Find if protected)
- Death (Collect souls)
- Guardian (Find if protected)
- Janitor (Find role and alibi)
- Forger (Find role and alibi)
- Lookout (Investigate)
- Seer (Investigate)
- Detective (Investigate)
- Spy (Find who the Mafia Visits)
- Tracker (Investigate)
- Werewolf (Track players scent)

**11: Spy Bug**

- Spy (Bug)

**12: Steal Messages**

- Witch (Get target messages)
- Necromancer (Get target messages)
- Retributionist (Get target messages)

**13: Convert**

- Apostle (Convert)

**14: SpyCultistCount**

- Spy (Get Cult Count)
wiki.article.standard.chat.title: Chat
wiki.article.standard.chat.text:
The chat is where players receive most information.
- When night ends, the chat will show if you were attacked, roleblocked, transported and much more.
- Usually, players can't send messages at night, but some roles can.
- Not all messages can be seen by everyone, normal messages have icons that represent what chat group the message was sent in.
wiki.article.standard.playerList.title: Players
wiki.article.standard.playerList.text:
The players menu shows a list of all players in the game.
- This is where you go to select a player to use your ability or vote them. When it is possible to select or vote a player, a button appears.
- Click on a players name to prepend a whisper command to the chat box.
- Next to players names, you can see if they are dead, and potentially see their role label.
- Press the filter button to only see messages that include that players name.
- Some roles will display some information at the top of the player list
wiki.article.standard.alibi.title: Alibi
wiki.article.standard.alibi.text:
In order to find out who the mafia is, townies need to share information they have in order to deduce who is lying about their role. This is done with the use of alibis, which are records of the abilities you have used and information you have gathered. Alibis are posted in the chat and graveyard when the player dies. Here is an example of a typical alibi that a Detective would have.

> Detective
Night 1: Deodat Lawson - Innocent
Night 2: Samuel Parris - Suspicious

When the Detective posts this alibi in chat, they provide evidence to other players that on the second night, they found Samuel Parris as suspicious, implying that Samuel Parris is a mafia member. If the town believes the Detective, they will likely vote the suspicious player out.

For a mafia member to pretend to be a town role, they need to write a fake alibi to blend in with the town roles. _IF A PLAYER DOES NOT HAVE AN ALIBI, THEY ARE LIKELY A MAFIA MEMBER_ who doesn't know how to write a fake alibi, and they should be directed to this page.
wiki.article.standard.graveyard.title: Graveyard
wiki.article.standard.graveyard.text:
The graveyard can help keep track of what roles are in the game and who has them
- The outline list on the left shows what roles can be in the game
    - Click on an outline to cross it out to help keep track of what roles people are.
- The graves on the right show who is dead
   - If you click on a grave, you can see what their alibi and role was, as well as other related information
wiki.article.generated.role_set.title: Role Set
wiki.article.generated.all_text.title: All text
wiki.article.role:
# \0 ### \1
### Guide \2 ### Abilities \3 ### Attributes \4 ### Extra \5
### Role Limit: \6 ### Defense: \7
### Keywords \8
wiki.article.role.noGuide: There is no guide section written for this page.
wiki.article.role.noAbilities: There is no abilities section written for this page.
wiki.article.role.noAttributes: There is no attributes section written for this page.
wiki.article.role.noExtra: There is no extras section written for this page.
wiki.article.role.jailor.guide: During the day, choose one player to jail each night. You can talk to your prisoner during the night, and they will not be told who you are. You should interrogate your prisoner to find out what their role is, and if you think they are evil, you can choose to execute them. You may execute up to three times, but if you execute a townie, you can not jail anyone anymore. The players you jail are immune to many abilities including attacks and are roleblocked.
wiki.article.role.jailor.abilities:
* Choose one player to jail during the day
* Visit your prisoner to execute them
wiki.article.role.jailor.attributes:
* You may talk with your prisoner at night
* If you execute a townie, you forfeit the ability to jail prisoners, and lose all execution uses
* Players in jail are immune to most abilities while in jail
* Jailed players can't visit
* Other players are told when their target is jailed
wiki.article.role.jailor.extra:
* The Jailor can not execute on night one
* If you execute a townie, or run out of executions, you can not target anymore
* You will invisibly roleblock the player you put in jail
* Players in jail don't see your name on your messages. The messages you send appear to be from the jailor
* If you jail a cult or mafia member, their teammates know that that player is in jail
wiki.article.role.mayor.guide: You can choose to reveal during the day to make your vote count as three votes. When you reveal, everyone is told you are the mayor.
wiki.article.role.mayor.abilities: * Reveal during the day to triple your voting power, showing everyone that you are the Mayor
wiki.article.role.mayor.attributes: * You get 3 votes during both voting and judgement after you reveal
wiki.article.role.mayor.extra:
* If you are converted to a different role, players will still see that you are the mayor
* Revealing does not increase the number of votes required to put someone on trial
wiki.article.role.transporter.guide: You can select two players at night. If somebody else tries to visit the first player, they will instead visit the second player, and vice versa. In general, you want to transport innocent players with suspicious ones to divert a potential attack onto the suspicious player.
wiki.article.role.transporter.abilities: * Visit two players to transport them
wiki.article.role.transporter.attributes:
* All visits to first player instead visit the second player
* All visits to the second player instead visit first player
* The players you visit get a message saying that they were transported
wiki.article.role.transporter.extra:
* Some abilities are not affected by yours due to the priority system. For example: You can't stop a jester from haunting their target using a transport, this depends on priorities and whether or not an ability is indirect
* A transporters visits can not be changed by another transporter
* Astral visits will still be transported
wiki.article.role.sheriff.guide: You can select a player to find if they're innocent or suspicious. If they're suspicious, they're _likely_ evil. You should tell the town the information you get daily. Selecting suspicious looking players often gives the most important information. Your information could potentially be wrong, some evil roles have innocent auras, and some evil roles can make other players look suspicious.
wiki.article.role.sheriff.abilities: * Visit a player to learn if they're innocent or suspicious
wiki.article.role.sheriff.attributes:
* Townies register as innocent
* Non-townies register as suspicious
wiki.article.role.sheriff.extra:
* A suspicious aura makes the player with the aura register as suspicious to you
* An innocent aura makes the player with the aura register as innocent to you
wiki.article.role.lookout.guide: You can select a player to find out who else visited them. Targeting players who you think will die will likely allow you to see who killed them, giving important information. You should tell the town the information you get daily.
wiki.article.role.lookout.abilities: * Visit a player to find all other visitors to them
wiki.article.role.lookout.extra:
* You can't see astral visits
* A framer may end up impacting your results
wiki.article.role.spy.guide: Select a player to find what happens to them tonight. Each night you will passively learn who the mafia visited, whether or not the cult can convert, and how many cultists are alive. You should tell the town the information you get daily. Usually, the mafia can not visit themselves, so anyone who you see the mafia visits is likely not a mafia member.
wiki.article.role.spy.abilities:
* You are told who each mafia member visits, but not the mafia members' names
* You are told how many cultists are alive
* At the start of night, you are told whether or not the cult can convert tonight
* Visit a player to bug their house
wiki.article.role.spy.attributes: * Your bug will tell you when your target receives a message saying they are silenced, roleblocked, protected, possessed, or transported
wiki.article.role.spy.extra:
* Your passive information is always correct
* You can not see mafia member's astral visits
* If a hypnotist makes a player be told they are silenced, roleblocked, protected, possessed, or transported, your bug will report the message they were sent
wiki.article.role.tracker.guide: You can select a player each night to find out who that player visited. If the selected player visited another player on the night that player died, it's possible they are the killer. You should tell the town the information you get daily. You should try to select people who you think are lying about where they are going.
wiki.article.role.tracker.abilities: * Visit a player to see who they visit
wiki.article.role.tracker.extra:
* A Framer can make players appear to have visited someone they didn't visit
* You can't see Astral visits
wiki.article.role.seer.guide: You can select two people each night to learn if they are friends or enemies. You should tell the town the information you get daily. You should try to choose one player who you are certain is innocent, and one player who you think is evil.
wiki.article.role.seer.abilities: * Visit two players to learn if they are friends or enemies
wiki.article.role.seer.attributes:
* If two players are friends they can win together
* If two players are enemies they can't win together
wiki.article.role.seer.extra: * Players with suspicious aura register as enemies with everyone* Players with innocent aura register as friends with everyone
wiki.article.role.psychic.guide:
You receive a vision every night.

On even nights, the vision lists two players. At least one of them is a townie.
    
On odd nights, the vision will list three players. At least one of them is not a townie. 
    
You should tell the town the information you get daily.
wiki.article.role.psychic.abilities:
* Get an evil vision on odd nights
* Get a good vision on even nights
wiki.article.role.psychic.attributes:
* Evil visions list three players, at least one of them is not a townie
* Good visions list two players, at least one of them is a townie
wiki.article.role.psychic.extra:
* If there aren't enough evil or good players to have a vision, the ability fails
* You can not be listed in your own vision
* You still get visions after you are dead
* You do not visit the players in your vision
* Players with a suspicious aura can't be listed in your good vision
* Players with an innocent aura can't be listed in your evil vision
wiki.article.role.doctor.guide: You can select a player to protect each night. You should try to protect people you think are townies who will be attacked. You can only choose yourself once.
wiki.article.role.doctor.abilities: * Visit a player to grant protected defense for that night
wiki.article.role.doctor.attributes: * If you visit yourself, you lose the ability to select yourself
wiki.article.role.doctor.extra:
* You are told if the player you visit is attacked
* The player you visit is told they are protected only if they get attacked
wiki.article.role.bodyguard.guide: You can select a player to protect each night. If the player you protect is attacked, you are attacked instead, but you attack the attacker. You should try to protect people you think are townies who will be attacked. You can only target yourself once.
wiki.article.role.bodyguard.abilities:
* Visit another player
    * When any players visit your target with an attacking visit, they are redirected into visiting and attacking you
    * If you redirect an attackers visit into yourself, you attack all attackers
* Visit yourself
    * You have protected defense tonight
    * You don't redirect any attacks
    * You lose the ability to select yourself
wiki.article.role.bodyguard.attributes: * You have an indirect armor-piercing attack
wiki.article.role.bodyguard.extra:
* You will be told if your target is attacked
* Your target is told that they were protected if they were attacked
* If your target is attacked by multiple visits, you will attack back for each visit
wiki.article.role.crusader.guide: You can select a player to protect each night and attack one random other player who visits them. You should try to protect people you think are townies who will be attacked. You could easily accidentally kill townies, so you should try to make sure no other townies visit the player you protect.
wiki.article.role.crusader.abilities:
* Visit a player to grant protected defense for that night
* Attack a random visitor of the player you protect
wiki.article.role.crusader.attributes:
* Your attack prioritizes a random evil player over townies
* You can't attack yourself
wiki.article.role.crusader.extra:
* You can't select yourself
* You are told if your target is attacked
* Your target is only be told that they are protected if they are attacked
* Your attack is indirect and basic
* Your ability fails if your target is in jail
wiki.article.role.reveler.guide: You can select a player to roleblock everyone visiting them, preventing them from being attacked. You should try to protect people you think are townies who you want to keep alive. Townies are also roleblocked when visiting your target, so select your target carefully.
wiki.article.role.reveler.abilities: * Visit a player to roleblock everyone who visits them
wiki.article.role.reveler.attributes: * Your target isn't told they are the target of a reveler
wiki.article.role.reveler.extra:
* You can't select yourself
* You don't roleblock astral visitors to your target
* You don't roleblock yourself
* Your ability fails if your target is in jail
wiki.article.role.trapper.guide: You can select a player to set a trap on them. A trap protects the player with the trap and attacks players who try to attack the trapped player. You must wait 1 night to build a trap before you can set it. Once the trap is triggered it is dismantled, and then you must wait another night to set it. Select yourself to dismantle the trap. You should try to put the trap on townies to protect them.
wiki.article.role.trapper.abilities:
* While the trap is ready
    * Visit a player to set a trap on them
    * You can't select yourself
* While the trap is set
    * Visit yourself to dismantle the trap
    * You can only select yourself
    * The player with the trap on them has protected defense as long as they have the trap on them
    * If a player visits the player with the trap, the trap will trigger. You will be told which roles trigger the trap and astral attack the players attacking the trapped player
* While the trap is dismantled
    * Wait one night for the trap to be ready
    * If you are roleblocked, it the trap will not become ready
    * You can not target anyone
wiki.article.role.trapper.attributes:
* You can only have one trap set at a time
* The trap still triggers even if you are roleblocked or dead
* When your trap is triggered, you will be told which roles visited the trapped player, even if those roles didn't attack the trapped player
* The trap will still trigger even if nobody attacks the trapped player
* The trap will only attack players who attacked the trapped player
* You have an indirect, armor-piercing attack
wiki.article.role.trapper.extra:
* Astral visits don't trigger the trap
* You can set a trap on jailed players
* You can't trigger your own trap. You don't register yourself in the traps results, nor ever be attacked by your own trap
* When the player with the trap is attacked, you are told they are attacked, and they are told they are protected
wiki.article.role.escort.guide: You can select a player to roleblock them, stopping them from using their ability. You should try to choose evil players, especially the ones with powerful abilities
wiki.article.role.escort.abilities: * Visit a player to roleblock them
wiki.article.role.escort.attributes:
* You can't be roleblocked
* Your target is told when they are roleblocked, even if they are immune to being roleblocked
wiki.article.role.escort.extra: * When someone is roleblocked, their visits are wiped, so they don't visit anyone
wiki.article.role.medium.guide: You can talk with the dead at night. After you die, you can choose to allow a living player of your selection to speak with the dead two times, this is called a haunt. You can also speak with other mediums at night. On the first night, you should attempt to contact any other possible mediums to learn if there are any. You should try to find information from other players and tell the town what dead players think about the game.
wiki.article.role.medium.abilities:
* At night, you can read and send messages in the dead chat group
* While dead, choose a living player during the day to haunt at night, putting that player in the haunt chat group during the night.
wiki.article.role.medium.extra:
* While in jail, you can read from dead chat group, but you can't send to it. Haunted players can read AND send to dead chat, even if in jail
* While any dead medium haunts any living player, all dead mediums, haunted players, and dead players are together in the dead chat group
* Each medium can do two haunts, so two mediums can do four haunts
wiki.article.role.retributionist.guide: You may select a dead player to possess and force them to visit a player you select. You can only choose to possess dead townies. You can not possess the same player more than once.
wiki.article.role.retributionist.abiliti:
* Visit two players to make the first player visit the second player
* Visit three players to make the first player visit the second and third player
* The first player you select must appear as a dead townie in the graveyard
wiki.article.role.retributionist.attribu:
* The first player you visit is told that they were possessed or immune to possession
* You are told all night information messages that your target gets told
* You can't select a dead player who you have already possessed
wiki.article.role.retributionist.extra:
* You are immune to getting roleblocked and possession
* You can force your target to visit any living player
* All your visits are astral except the first
* If you do not end up possessing that player you select, you can select them the again
wiki.article.role.journalist.guide: During the day, you may select one player to interview each night. You can talk with the player you interview at night. Write a public journal to have it posted at the start of every day. If a player you interview doesn't tell you their alibi then they are likely evil, and you should post that in your journal.
wiki.article.role.journalist.abilities:
* Your journal is posted publicly every morning while you alive if it is set to public
* During the day you may choose a player to interview that night
wiki.article.role.journalist.attributes:
*  You can talk with the player you interview at night
* Your journal is posted anonymously, nobody knows who wrote it
* Players you interview do not see your name on your messages, instead, the messages you send appear to be from the journalist.
wiki.article.role.journalist.extra:
* If there is more than one Journalist with a public journal, the journals are posted in player order
* Your journal does not get posted if you are silenced or roleblocked
* If you interview a cultist or mafia member, their teammates are told that the player is being interviewed
wiki.article.role.vigilante.guide: You can select a player to attack, but if you kill a townie, you will commit suicide on the following night (and probably cause town to lose). You have three bullets and you can not shoot on night one. If you attack someone and they survive it is likely that they were either protected by a protective role, or they are a role that is armored. Most roles that are armored are evil.
wiki.article.role.vigilante.abilities:
* Visit a player to attack and spend a bullet
* If you kill a townie you will commit suicide on the following night
* You have three bullets
wiki.article.role.vigilante.attributes:
* If your attack overpowers a townies defense and they die, you commit suicide on the following night
* When it is night one, when you have 0 bullets left, when you are going to commit suicide, or when you have already committed suicide, you can not select or attack anyone
wiki.article.role.vigilante.extra:
* You only have a basic attack
* Even while dead, killing someone requires and spends a bullet (such as when you get possessed)
wiki.article.role.veteran.guide: You may choose to go on Alert, attacking everyone who visits you. You can go on Alert three times. You should try to bait evil players into attacking you on nights that you alert to kill them.
wiki.article.role.veteran.abilities:
* Visit yourself to go on alert, attacking everyone who visits you
* While on alert, you have protected defense
wiki.article.role.veteran.attributes:
* You have an indirect, armor-piercing attack
* You have an astral visit
* You have three alerts
* You are told when you attack a visitor
* Players who visit you while on alert are told they are attacked by a veteran
wiki.article.role.veteran.extra:
* While you have 0 alerts left, you can not select yourself
* You are immune to getting roleblocked and possession
wiki.article.role.deputy.guide: Once per game, you may select a player during the day to attack them. If you kill a townie, you instantly leave town. If you attack someone and they survive it is likely that they are a role that is armored. Most roles that are armored are evil.
wiki.article.role.deputy.abilities: * Once per game, during the discussion or voting phase after day 1, you may choose a player to attack.
wiki.article.role.deputy.attributes:
* If the player you attack has defense, they are told they were attacked by a deputy
* When you kill someone, everyone is told a deputy shot someone
wiki.article.role.deputy.extra:
* You only have a basic attack
* You can not attack day 1
wiki.article.role.godfather.guide: You can select a player to attack each night. Choose a backup to attack for you when you are roleblocked. You should try to kill townies who are likely to stop you from winning or have powerful abilities, but be careful about town protective roles.
wiki.article.role.godfather.abilities:
* Visit a player to attack
* Choose another living mafia member to be your backup at any time
* While you are roleblocked, the backup will attack the first player they visit
wiki.article.role.godfather.attributes:
* You are armored
* You always have an innocent aura
* When you are roleblocked, the mafia is told that the backup attacks for you
wiki.article.role.godfather.extra:
* You only have a basic attack
* When the mafia has no Godfather or Mafioso, a random mafia member converts to a godfather
* When the Godfather dies, their current backup becomes the Godfather
* You can not target other mafia members
wiki.article.role.mafioso.guide: You can select players to attack them. You should try to kill townies who are likely to stop you from winning.
wiki.article.role.mafioso.extra: * You can't target other mafia members
wiki.article.role.consort.guide: You can select a player to roleblock and hypnotize. If they are roleblocked, they can not use their ability that night. You can choose a message to send to your target. You can also choose to not roleblock, and only send them messages.
wiki.article.role.consort.abilities: * Visit a player to roleblock and choose a message to show them.
wiki.article.role.consort.attributes:
* You can not be roleblocked
* You may choose to not roleblock your target
* Your target is told when you roleblock them.
* You must always send at least one message
wiki.article.role.consort.extra:
* You can't select other mafia members
* When you roleblock someone, their visits will be cleared
wiki.article.role.blackmailer.guide: You can select a player to silence. The silenced player can't speak during the next day, and they can't vote during the next day. You should choose talkative players who might speak out against a mafia member, or players who have information that you want to suppress.
wiki.article.role.blackmailer.abilities: * Visit a player to silence them during the next day
wiki.article.role.blackmailer.attributes:
* Silenced players can not vote during the voting phase
* Silenced players can not talk in chat or out loud during the entire next day
wiki.article.role.blackmailer.extra:
* The silenced player is no longer be silenced at the start of the next night
* You cannot select other mafia members
wiki.article.role.consigliere.guide: You can select a player to learn their role, who they visited, and who visited them. You should communicate the information you get to the rest of the mafia.
wiki.article.role.consigliere.abilities:
* Visit a player to
    * Learn their role
    * Learn who visited them
    * Learn who they visited
* All whispers can be read regardless of whether or not they were sent to you
wiki.article.role.consigliere.extra: * You can't select other mafia members
wiki.article.role.necromancer.guide: You can select a dead player to possess and force them to visit a player you select. You can only choose to possess dead townies. You can not possess the same player more than twice.
wiki.article.role.necromancer.abilities:
* Select two players to make the first player select the second player
* Select three players to make the first player select the second and third player
* The first player you select must appear as a dead player in the graveyard
wiki.article.role.necromancer.attributes:
* The first player you visit is told that they were possessed or immune to possession
* You are told all night information messages that the player you possess gets told
* You can't select a dead player who you have already possessed
wiki.article.role.necromancer.extra:
* You are immune to getting roleblocked and possession
* You can force players you possess visit any living player
* All your visits are astral except the first
* If you do not end up possessing that player you select, you can select them the again
wiki.article.role.witch.guide: You can select a player to possess and force them to visit a player you select.
wiki.article.role.witch.abilities:
* Visit two players to make the first player visit the second player
* Visit three players to make the first player visit the second and third player
wiki.article.role.witch.attributes:
* The first player you visit is told that they were possessed or immune to possession
* You are told all night information messages that the player you possess gets told
wiki.article.role.witch.extra:
* You are immune to getting roleblocked and possession
* You can't select other mafia members for your first target, but you can select any living player for your second and third targets
* All your visits are astral except the first
wiki.article.role.janitor.guide: You can select a player to clean them. Cleaning a player on the night they die erases their role and alibi from their grave. You can only use your ability three times. You should usually choose the same player as the godfather, because they will probably die.
wiki.article.role.janitor.abilities:
* Visit a player to clean their grave only if they die tonight
* If a grave is cleaned, that player's role and alibi do not appear in the graveyard
* You are told the role and alibi of the player you cleaned.
wiki.article.role.janitor.attributes: * You only have three uses of your ability
wiki.article.role.janitor.extra:
* If you visit a player to attempt to clean them, it costs an ability use, even if they don't die
* If you are roleblocked, it doesn't cost an ability use
* If you visit a jailed player, it doesn't cost an ability use
* You can't target other mafia members
wiki.article.role.forger.guide: You can select a player to forge their role and alibi. Forging a player on the night they die edits their role and alibi in their grave. You only can use your ability two times. You should usually choose the same player as the godfather, because they will probably die.
wiki.article.role.forger.abilities:
* Visit a player to forge their grave only if they die tonight
* If a grave is forged, that player's role and alibi appear to be what you choose
* You are told the original role and alibi of the player you forge
wiki.article.role.forger.attributes: * You only have two uses of your ability
wiki.article.role.forger.extra:
* If you visit a player to attempt to clean them, it costs an ability use, even if they don't die
* If you are roleblocked, it doesn't cost an ability use
* If you visit a jailed player, it doesn't cost an ability use
* You can't target other mafia members
* If you choose no role, their grave will show what their original role is
* If you leave their alibi completely blank, it looks to be the same as their original alibi
wiki.article.role.framer.guide: You can select a player to frame them, making them appear to be evil to investigative roles. If you choose two players, investigative roles will see that the first player visited second one. Try to frame players who already look a little suspicious so investigative roles might choose them.
wiki.article.role.framer.abilities:
* Visit a player to give them a suspicious aura for the night
* Visit two players to
  * give first player you visit a suspicious aura for the night
  * make the first player appear to visit the second player you visit
wiki.article.role.framer.extra:
-A suspicious aura will make the player with it look suspicious to a Detective, they can appear as the evil player to a Psychic, and they will be enemies with everyone to a Seer
* You can't select other mafia members for your first target, but you can select any player for your second target, including dead players and other mafia members
wiki.article.role.jester.guide: Get lynched during the day to win. If you win, you can attack any living player who voted you guilty or abstained. Try to look suspicious without making it obvious that you are the Jester.
wiki.article.role.jester.abilities:
* When you are lynched, you win
* On the night after you are lynched, attack the first player you select
wiki.article.role.jester.attributes:
* You always have an innocent aura
* If you select nobody on the night after you are lynched, you will attack a random living player who did not vote you innocent
* You have a protection-piercing, top priority attack
wiki.article.role.jester.extra: * Your attack goes before Transporter, Witch, or Necromancer, so they can not force you to kill someone else.
wiki.article.role.executioner.guide: Get your execution target lynched to win. If you win, you leave town at the start of night. You should try to claim something that makes people think your target is suspicious.
wiki.article.role.executioner.abilities: * At the beginning of the game, you are assigned an execution target. It is a random townie, but never a Mayor, Journalist, Jailor, Deputy, Veteran, or Transporter
wiki.article.role.executioner.attributes:
* When your execution target is lynched, you win
* After you win, you will leave town at the start of the following night
* You always have an innocent aura
* You are armored
wiki.article.role.executioner.extra:
* If your target dies by something other than lynching, you will convert to a jester immediately
* If there are no valid targets in the game when you become the executioner, you will convert to a jester
wiki.article.role.doomsayer.guide: Guess the role of three different players to win. If you guess the role of three different living players correctly, you attack all three of them, and leave town. You should listen to what people claim and try to push for more people to claim roles.
wiki.article.role.doomsayer.abilities: * Use the Doomsayer menu to guess the role of three different living players in one night, attacking them and winning
wiki.article.role.doomsayer.attributes:
* When you win, you leave town at the start of the next morning
* You have to guess the exact role of townies, but you only need to guess the faction of all other roles
* You can't try to guess town investigative roles
* When there are not enough players left for you to guess, you convert to a jester
* You have an indirect, protection-piercing attack
wiki.article.role.doomsayer.extra:
* Your three guesses must be three different players
* You will still win, even if the players you guessed correctly don't die
* You do not visit when you attack
* You can't try to guess a martyr
wiki.article.role.politician.guide: * If the town would win, instead you win and they all die. Try to help to the town to win while staying alive.
wiki.article.role.politician.abilities: * When town would win, you win, instantly attack ever townie, and all politicians leave town
wiki.article.role.politician.attributes:
* You win with other politicians
* When you first become this role, if there are no townies alive, you become a jester
* You have a protection-piercing attack
wiki.article.role.politician.extra:
* If all townies die, you leave town
* If the only players left are politicians, you win
wiki.article.role.arsonist.guide: You can select a player each night to douse them in gasoline. Target yourself to ignite and kill every player who is doused. You know who is doused. Try not to douse players you think the mafia will kill, because then you waste your night dousing someone who is going to die anyway.
wiki.article.role.arsonist.abilities:
* Visit a player to douse them
* Visit yourself to ignite to all doused players
* If a player visits you, you will douse them
wiki.article.role.arsonist.attributes:
* You can't be doused
* You are shown who is doused
* All doused players have a suspicious aura while you are alive
wiki.article.role.arsonist.extra:
* If you are roleblocked, you still douse visitors
* If you are in jail, you douse the jailor, and you will still douse players who visit you
* Igniting a doused player is an indirect, protection-piercing attack
wiki.article.role.werewolf.guide: You have a different ability depending on whether or not it is a full moon tonight. On full moon nights, you can select someone to attack them and rampage, attacking everyone who visits them. On non full moon nights, you can select someone to gain their scent. You also passively gain the scent of everyone who visits you. If you have someones scent, you will know who they visit every night for the rest of the game. Try to attack players who will get visited by many people in order to kill more players. The information you receive can help you claim town investigative roles such as the Tracker
wiki.article.role.werewolf.abilities:
* On full moon nights
    * Visit a player to attack and rampage
    * If you visit nobody on a full moon night, you rampage yourself
* On non-full moon nights
    * Visit a player to gain their scent.
 You passively gain the scent of every player that visits you.
wiki.article.role.werewolf.attributes:
* You have an armor-piercing attack
* While you are in jail, you attack all Jailors who do not choose to execute you
* You are told who you have the scent of
* You still track the scent of players after you die
* While it is a non-full moon night, you have an innocent aura
* Each night, you are told who each player you have the scent of visits
wiki.article.role.werewolf.extra:
* You will attack yourself if you visit yourself
* You will not rampage the jailor while in jail
* You will still attack or gain the scent of visits to you when you are in jail
* You will still track the players you have the scent of while you are in jail
* You do not attack or gain the scent of astral visitors
* A roleblock has no effect on you besides erasing your visits. If you are roleblocked, it is as if you visited nobody
* Players attacked by a rampage are indirectly attacked
wiki.article.role.death.guide: Guess what player will die during night by targeting them, If you guess correctly you will collect a soul, you will also collect a soul passively each night. Once you collect six souls, everyone will be told that death collected six souls at the start of the day, if you survive that day, you will attack everyone and win the game at the start of night.
wiki.article.role.death.abilities:
* If the player you visit dies tonight, you collect a soul
* You gain an additional soul each night
wiki.article.role.death.attributes:
* Once you've collected six souls, you curse the town. At the start of the next night you win and attack everyone.
* You have invincible defense once you have six souls
* You have a protection-piercing attack
wiki.article.role.death.extra: * You will still passively gain souls in jail
wiki.article.role.amnesiac.guide: You can choose a role to become on the next night. You can choose a certain outline to and get a random role if you want, or get a specific role.
wiki.article.role.amnesiac.abilities: * Choose an outline to become a role from that outline at night
wiki.article.role.amnesiac.attributes: * You are immune to being roleblocked and jailed
wiki.article.role.amnesiac.extra:
* You can choose an outline like "Neutral Killing", and you will get a random neutral killing role, or choose an outline like "Jailor" and confirm that you get the jailor
* If you choose a role that was excluded from the game you will stay as the Amnesiac
wiki.article.role.martyr.guide: If you die, you win, and everyone commits suicide in an attempt to follow you to the afterlife. The entire town knows that you're the martyr. Good Luck
wiki.article.role.martyr.abilities:
* Visit yourself to attack yourself and spend one bullet
* You start with 5 bullets
* When you die, everyone else commits suicide and you win.
wiki.article.role.martyr.attributes:
* When you have zero bullets left, you leave town and lose
* You have a basic attack
wiki.article.role.martyr.extra:
* When you visit a player while you have zero bullets left you will not attack them
* You're an ex-cultist, they rejected you because you told the truth
wiki.article.role.apostle.guide: You can select a player to either convert them to a cultist, or attack. You can convert starting on night two, from then on, you need two sacrifices to convert. Each time a player dies, you gain a sacrifice. When you are the only cultist and you can not convert, you will attack instead of convert.
wiki.article.role.apostle.abilities:
* On nights you can't convert
    * If you are the only cultist, visit a player to attack
* On nights you can convert
    * Visit a player to convert them to a Zealot
wiki.article.role.apostle.attributes:
* You can convert on night two
* After night two, converting costs 2 sacrifices
* A sacrifice is gained each time a player dies, including a player who died the night you converted last
wiki.article.role.apostle.extra:
* You can not convert a player who has any defense
* There will only be one Apostle, if you die, the next oldest cultist will become an Apostle
* You can not target other cultists
* Converting is blocked by armor and protection
wiki.article.role.disciple.guide: You have no ability except to help the cult by lying. Even though you have no useful ability, you are essential to your team, you should help protect an Apostle by lying. If an Apostle dies, and you are the next oldest cultist, you are converted to an Apostle. You should lie and communicate with fellow cultists to convince the town to lynch someone who isn't a cult.
wiki.article.role.disciple.abilities: * When an Apostle dies and you are the oldest cultist, you will become an Apostle
wiki.article.role.disciple.attributes: * The oldest cultist is the one that has been a cultist the longest. If there is a tie, the oldest cultist is the one with the lowest player number
wiki.article.role.zealot.guide: You can select a player to attack them. You become a disciple when another player is converted to zealot. Make sure you don't choose the same player as an Apostle, because then you might kill a cultist.
wiki.article.role.zealot.attributes: * When another player is converted to a zealot, you become a disciple.
wiki.article.role.zealot.extra:
* There will never be more than one zealot
* You can not select other cultists
